messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Healing from schoolwounds
messages.msgSnippet: ... First you have to stop saying he won t even attempt to do anything . He s doing plenty of things, just not anything schoolish. You will need to learn to
messages.messageBody:
--- ann <worslo@...> wrote:

> now he's at home he won't even
> attempt to do
> anything. he plays lots of creative games, writes
> birthday
> cards....cos he doesn't link it with school, but at
> the first whiff of
> anything schooly...he gets the jitters.

First you have to stop saying "he won't even attempt
to do anything". He's doing plenty of things, just not
anything schoolish. You will need to learn to value
what he's doing. Only that will help him heal.
Be with him, play with him and see all the real
learning that goes on.

Read here and on Sandra Dodd's website
http://sandradodd.com/

and on Joyce's website
http://joyfullyrejoycing.com/

Manisha





____________________________________________________________________________________

messages.subject: Healing from schoolwounds
messages.msgSnippet: my six year old has had horrendous experiences of school. he had a real school phobia  hated being parted from me, threw up every morning, ate nothing for
messages.messageBody:
my six year old has had horrendous experiences of school. he had a
real 'school phobia ' hated being parted from me, threw up every
morning, ate nothing for dinner unless forced to by the dinner
ladies...with the threat he couldn't go out to play,. i took him out 5
months ago cos he hated his lot in life, said he was bored, and lost
all of his twinkle. now he's at home he won't even attempt to do
anything. he plays lots of creative games, writes birthday
cards....cos he doesn't link it with school, but at the first whiff of
anything schooly...he gets the jitters. my never been to school 4 year
old, wants to do ' letters ' abc, etc, and add ups til the son goes
down, but my son with a years plus school experience is having none.
he obviously needs to unschool, and heal. how do i help him do
this ???? doesn't help when my ex...accuses me of leading them to
become social misfits and dunces..OMG....any ideas would be truly
welcomed...thanks...Ann x
